unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, November 8, 2024 – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd. (MSEDCL) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program. The initiative, aimed at modernizing the state's power grid and reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, has seen the installation of over 500,000 smart meters across urban and rural areas, including pilot projects in Pune and Nagpur.
normalised: Mumbai, eighth November two thousand and twenty four – Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution C O. Limited (M S E D C L) has announced significant progress in its smart meter deployment program. The initiative, aimed at modernizing the state's power grid and reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, has seen the installation of over five hundred thousand smart meters across urban and rural areas, including pilot projects in Pune and Nagpur.

unnormalised: The smart meters enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, empowering consumers to make informed decisions about their energy usage and potentially lower their monthly bills. MSEDCL expects to complete Phase 1, covering 2.5 million households, by 31/12/2025. Consumers can access their consumption data via a mobile app, launched on 15/08/2024.
normalised: The smart meters enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, empowering consumers to make informed decisions about their energy usage and potentially lower their monthly bills. M S E D C L expects to complete Phase one, covering two point five million households, by thirty first december two thousand and twenty five. Consumers can access their consumption data via a mobile app, launched on fifteenth august two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Concerns regarding data privacy are being addressed through robust security protocols compliant with national standards. A help desk is available 24/7 to resolve consumer queries. Initial reports suggest a reduction in meter reading errors and faster outage detection following the implementation which started at 09:00 hrs on October 1st, 2023. The program aligns with the national Smart Meter National Programme aiming to replace all conventional meters by 2027.
